009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * Simple global thresholder which sets the threshold centered between the
015 * image's minimum and maximum pixel value. See Sec. 9.1.2 of [1] for additional
016 * details (Eq. 9.12).
017 * </p>
018 * <p>
019 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
020 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
021 * </p>
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2022/08/23
025 *
026 */
027public class MinMaxThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
028        
029        public MinMaxThresholder() {
030                super();
031        }
032
033        @Override
034        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
035                // calculate mean of entire image:
036                int K = h.length;
037                int minVal, maxVal;
038                
039                // find the min. pixel value
040                for (minVal = 0; minVal < K; minVal++) {
041                        if (h[minVal] > 0) {
042                                break;
043                        }
044                }
045                
046                // find the max. pixel value
047                for (maxVal = K - 1; maxVal >= 0; maxVal--) {
048                        if (h[maxVal] > 0) {
049                                break;
050                        }
051                }
052                
053                int q = (minVal < maxVal) ? 
054                                (int) Math.floor((minVal + maxVal) / 2.0) : -1;
055                
056                return q;
057        }
058}
